column4: hey, I would like to install java on karmic. What's the usual way to do it? I bet there's more bother free way than manually downloading and installing
best way is to go into synaptic, and install the package ubuntu-restricted-extras .
but when I try to run a java app, it doesn't know what to open i with
and java is still not installed?
java verification on java.com fails also in ffox
should I try reinstalling the package?
a bunch of it is already installed, including java-common and other stuff
well the restricted extras should do it for you. do you have java-common installed?
yes I do. I wonder what is wrong
I never had any problems with java in jaunty. That's why I'm confus now.
the best I can suggest is reinstalling. Many people are discovering new problems in Karmic that we're all hoping will be fixed for the LTS release coming up
very well then. I will try reinstalling the entire restricted extras thing. thanks
no luck :/ it still opens my java app with gedit. what a shame. I can't believe this.
